newsitem.title: UK: Booker borrows to fund Nurdin & Peacock bid.
newsitem.headline: Booker borrows to fund Nurdin & Peacock bid.

text.p: LONDON, September 4 (LPC) - Booker Plc said on Wednesday it has bank funding for the 203 million stg cash portion of its agreed bid for Nurdin & Peacock Plc .
BZW, Bayerische Landesbank and Midland Bank will provide financing.
British food wholesaler Booker announced a 264 million stg bid for rival Nurdin & Peacock earlier on Wednesday.

The banks have put together co-ordinated bilateral facilites to fund the 203 million stg cash portion of the bid. In addition the banks will provide working capital facilities. The size and terms of the bilaterals are identical, according to sources close to the deal.

Booker said that it expects net borrowings to be approximately 400 million stg by the end of the year, but said that it believes this will be reduced by around 100 million stg over the next two years.
